definition: to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: The apartments were built to ease the housing shortage.
sentences.chinese: 那些公寓被建造以紓解房屋匱乏。

sentences.english: Ms. Ehrlich recommends weekly massages for the pain.
sentences.chinese: 厄利建議每週按摩來紓解疼痛。

sentences.english: I always take a slow, deep breath to relieve tension.
sentences.chinese: 我總是藉由緩慢的深呼吸來紓解緊張。

sentences.english: As they pulled, they sang to ease the pain.
sentences.chinese: 他們邊拉邊唱歌，紓解疼痛。

sentences.english: It is a perfect place to release all the tension and pressures.
sentences.chinese: 所有的壓力與緊張感能在此得到全面的紓解與釋放。

sentences.english: Do you think these measures are sufficient to relieve people's hardships?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲呢D紓解民困既措施足唔足夠？

sentences.english: Music can release stress in our daily life.
sentences.chinese: 音樂可以紓解日常生活中的壓力。

sentences.english: That in turn will help ease the demand on our public mortuary .
sentences.chinese: 如此一來，又可紓解民衆對殮葬服務的需求。

sentences.english: Used in bath water, it relieves rheumatalgia and has antiseptic action to urinary system.
sentences.chinese: 用來泡澡可紓解風溼痛，對泌尿系統亦有抗菌效果。

definition: to dredge/to open up a path for/to remove obstructions/to clear the way/to enlighten/persuasion
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
lit. to prescribe the right medicine for an illness (idiom); fig. to study a problem to find the right way to solve it/to take appropriate steps
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
